page.title: 06EXE FLOOD RELIEF SCHEME
page.content: The{River Exe}has many natural and man-made weirs. There are salmon and trout in the river and it is quite {clean.} Before the{Flood Relief Scheme}was built there was often flooding. The St.Thomas area used to get the worst floods, the most recent in 1960. The Scheme was started in 1963 and{opened {in 1977. It is mainly made of steel and concrete, took 50 men to build and is worth{Â£m10.}It stops flooding by carrying the extra water past the city and has gates to control the water, operated by the level of the river. The{bridges}for the Scheme were built on dry land and then dug out underneath. Station Road Bridge is made of steel and concrete and is 56m long.
